{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3405993,"name":"","username":"crueter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-07T13:51:31.255Z","cooked":"

Hello, I’m the developer of QFRCDashboard, a high-performance, low-footprint, Qt-based driver dashboard.

I’ve put considerable effort into ensuring its ease of use and stability, but I need your input on what makes a dashboard “good”.

Examples I can think of:

  • Copy/pasting widgets
  • Switching widgets based on their data type

There are plenty of features in QFRCDashboard that I’ve never really advertised, so if a feature you really want is actually already present, I will take care to make this feature more prominent.

For example, QFRCDashboard already supports automatic tab switching based on a NetworkTables value.

Please let me know your thoughts.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-07-07T13:51:31.255Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":18,"reads":419,"readers_count":418,"score":178.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":468393,"topic_slug":"what-do-you-want-to-see-in-a-dashboard","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/crueter/QFRCDashboard","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - crueter/QFRCDashboard: A reliable, high-performance, low-footprint dashboard for FRC use.","clicks":62}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50684,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6032 | QDash"},"post_url":"/t/what-do-you-want-to-see-in-a-dashboard/468393/1","custom_user_title":"6032 | QDash","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3406072,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-07T19:51:44.084Z","cooked":"
crueter:

I’ve put considerable effort into ensuring its ease of use and stability, but I need your input on what makes a dashboard “good”.

Documentation to the standard that a social studies teacher and high school freshman can implement it.

So many projects in the FRC programming space inhale audibly at this step, and it only leads to more frustration and distress than is necessary.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-07-07T19:51:44.084Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":29,"reads":349,"readers_count":348,"score":384.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":468393,"topic_slug":"what-do-you-want-to-see-in-a-dashboard","display_username":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/wpilib-as-volunteer-run-project/468434/17","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"WPILib as volunteer-run project","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":13}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":3095,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"says you should come to SCRIW in October"},"post_url":"/t/what-do-you-want-to-see-in-a-dashboard/468393/2","custom_user_title":"says you should come to SCRIW in October","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":11},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":13,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3406076,"name":"","username":"crueter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-07T19:56:31.409Z","cooked":"

Can you elaborate a bit?

If you mean creating the entire thing from scratch, that’s a fever dream. I’m not really sure what else you could mean by “implement”.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-07-07T19:56:40.753Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":344,"readers_count":343,"score":73.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":468393,"topic_slug":"what-do-you-want-to-see-in-a-dashboard","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":3095,"username":"Billfred","name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50684,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6032 | QDash"},"post_url":"/t/what-do-you-want-to-see-in-a-dashboard/468393/3","custom_user_title":"6032 | QDash","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3406078,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-07T20:08:41.109Z","cooked":"
crueter:

If you mean creating the entire thing from scratch, that’s a fever dream.

I wouldn’t say “from scratch”, but “from where the WPILib examples leave off” feels like the standard that needs to exist.

I don’t even love how WPILib approaches documentation given their position as the site FIRST points everyone to–most notably, their fingers-in-ears mentality about CAN motor controllers. But when so many projects take the tack of “this is easy to implement, just (insert Charlie Brown’s teacher talking here)” and call that documentation, I’m going to stick up on the side of over-communicating.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-07-07T20:08:41.109Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":330,"readers_count":329,"score":101.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":468393,"topic_slug":"what-do-you-want-to-see-in-a-dashboard","display_username":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/wpilib-as-volunteer-run-project/468434","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"WPILib as volunteer-run project","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":3095,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"says you should come to SCRIW in October"},"post_url":"/t/what-do-you-want-to-see-in-a-dashboard/468393/4","custom_user_title":"says you should come to SCRIW in October","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3406349,"name":"Nate Laverdure (he/him)","username":"Nate_Laverdure","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nate_laverdure/{size}/134005_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-08T17:46:36.590Z","cooked":"

","post_number":5,"post_type":3,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-07-08T17:46:36.715Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":79,"readers_count":78,"score":25.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":468393,"topic_slug":"what-do-you-want-to-see-in-a-dashboard","display_username":"Nate Laverdure (he/him)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/wpilib-as-volunteer-run-project/468434","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"WPILib as volunteer-run project","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":4999,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Cynicism isn't wisdom"},"action_code":"split_topic","post_url":"/t/what-do-you-want-to-see-in-a-dashboard/468393/5","custom_user_title":"Cynicism isn't wisdom","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3406086,"name":"","username":"crueter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-07T20:40:07.337Z","cooked":"

I’m still a bit confused? This isn’t really based on any WPILib examples, at all. Everything was baked by me with some usage of API docs. I will certainly document parts of my development process and some of the ways the dashboard works its magic, but this isn’t really something that other people need to cook themselves; it’s meant to be plug-and-play as a standard NT dashboard.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-07-07T20:40:07.337Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":256,"readers_count":255,"score":56.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":468393,"topic_slug":"what-do-you-want-to-see-in-a-dashboard","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":3095,"username":"Billfred","name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50684,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6032 | QDash"},"post_url":"/t/what-do-you-want-to-see-in-a-dashboard/468393/6","custom_user_title":"6032 | QDash","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3406104,"name":"seg9585","username":"seg9585","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/seg9585/{size}/1974_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-07T21:04:42.172Z","cooked":"

Here are a few things that stand out to me in a good UI:

  • Good data visualization (and plenty of customization options) including graphing with adjustable X/Y and time scales (with zoom-in features) and including multiple data items on the same graph. Ideally the graph persists to allow scroll-back as well
  • Ability to record and play back data natively and immediately (supplemental to something that’s recorded on-board)
  • Scaling of widgets so they aren’t forced to take up so much screen space. Too many Dashboards force-snap data to specific boxes
","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-07-07T21:06:10.671Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":247,"readers_count":246,"score":59.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":468393,"topic_slug":"what-do-you-want-to-see-in-a-dashboard","display_username":"seg9585","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6078,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/what-do-you-want-to-see-in-a-dashboard/468393/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3406129,"name":"","username":"crueter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-07T22:32:06.050Z","cooked":"
seg9585:

Good data visualization (and plenty of customization options) including graphing with adjustable X/Y and time scales (with zoom-in features) and including multiple data items on the same graph. Ideally the graph persists to allow scroll-back as well

I’ve put quite a bit of effort into the graph system while also trying not to overload it with features and effectively just create another AdvantageScope. However, scrollback would be great.

seg9585:

Ability to record and play back data natively and immediately (supplemental to something that’s recorded on-board)

I have thought about this; this would be a great way to effectively replay a match. However, unless I can effectively encode the camera data within the recording, then again, to me it feels like I’m creeping towards wheel reinvention vs. AdvantageScope.

seg9585:

Scaling of widgets so they aren’t forced to take up so much screen space. Too many Dashboards force-snap data to specific boxes

This is configurable to some extent; you can specify how many rows/columns you need, as well as title and text fonts. I’ve been playing around with various layout margins to maximize screen real estate without sacrificing visuals and will probably get some results out soon.

WPILib as volunteer-run project

What we need is folks who care enough about fixing/improving documentation to spend many hours of their free time doing exactly that

I’m not gonna say I’m the best at documentation nor will I claim to have tons of free time (college :/), but once I finish a few critical projects I have in the works, this is an area I would be ecstatic to contribute to.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-07-07T22:32:06.050Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":2,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":194,"readers_count":193,"score":68.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":468393,"topic_slug":"what-do-you-want-to-see-in-a-dashboard","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/wpilib-as-volunteer-run-project/468434/3","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"WPILib as volunteer-run project","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50684,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6032 | QDash"},"post_url":"/t/what-do-you-want-to-see-in-a-dashboard/468393/10","custom_user_title":"6032 | QDash","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3406130,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-07T22:39:15.478Z","cooked":"
crueter:

I will certainly document parts of my development process and some of the ways the dashboard works its magic, but this isn’t really something that other people need to cook themselves; it’s meant to be plug-and-play as a standard NT dashboard.

To be clear, I’m not talking about “how you created QFRCDashboard” but “how one uses QFRCDashboard”.

WPILib as volunteer-run project

What we need is folks who understand what the heck is going on and care enough about fixing/improving documentation to spend many hours of their free time doing exactly that—the door is open to make a positive impact on the entire FRC community!

Fixed that for you. Not for lack of trying (heck, in 2021 I was the sole programmer due to circumstances), but I’ve never felt equipped to do more than lob a couple GitHub issues when things make flagrantly little sense. And with the rise of COTS swerve and encoders going back to the motor controller, I feel even further behind.
